H0.text: Centripetal force is the type of force that Newton described, stating that every object in the universe attracts matter with an attraction depending on the mass of an object and the distance between the objects.

H1.text: Generalized force is the type of force that Sir Isaac Newton described, in which every object in the universe attracts matter and the attraction depends on the mass of an object and the distance between the objects.

H2.text: Centrifugal force is the type of force that Newton described, according to his statement that every object in the universe attracts matter and that the attraction depends on the mass of an object and the distance between the objects.

H3.text: Gravitational force is the type of force that Newton described, which states that every object in the universe attracts matter with a force that depends on the mass of the objects and the distance between them.

A4.text: Gravity is the law that every object with mass attracts every other object in the universe in proportion to each mass and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

A5.text: The force of gravity, F is written using the gravitational constant, G, as F = G m m′ / r² for two masses, m, and m′ separated by a distance r.
